well yeah cuz vacation is usually just relaxing while working is physically exausting usually
Relaxing bit is going home and being able to sleep in your own bed.
vacations are not as physically demanding as a lot of jobs, so if your vacation IS more physically demanding, then of course it's going to feel backwards
:thinking:

also, vacation isn't just for physical removal of your station, it's also a mental removal, though most people don't bother taking a break during vacation if their job doesn't require themn to be physically at a place to do a thing

Vacations are more mentally exhausting, because you are away from home not sleeping in a bed your are used to, spending lots of money so that's always going to be on your subconcious, and god forbid if you have kids and bring them with you.
then you're doing it wrong.
it's not a vacation if you're taking your mental baggage with you.
you're supposed to leave it behind.
You always are going to have mental baggage, because the vacation adds it's own.
If you are poor like me, you are constantly thinking about how much money this is costing.
yeah, but it's getting you away from the dullness of normal life, it's supposed to be different, interesting, and fun.

then you're just planning it wrong :P
cuz it CAN be that, even for poor people lol
it just requires a different approach
You remove yourself from your current routines, and just get away.

it's not a necessity
so money really doesn't affect it for the most part.

also, people take physical vacations away from house because being there reminds them of the generic drone of life, and getting away from that helps them. I don't personally need that, but I'm pretty flexible.
